alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 1:55PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Potential hydrologic flooding caused by northerly winds and ice blockages along the St. Clair River south of East China. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 PM EST, St. Clair emergency management and Algonac Fire reported water levels along the St. Clair River south of East China near the top of breakwalls. - St. Clair River south of East China is the most likely place to experience minor flooding along the shoreline. Winds are expected to flip southerly late this evening allowing the threat for minor river flooding to subside. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Algonac, East China, Marine City, Harsens Island and Pearl Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
